content.text:
You are a GUI agent. You are given a task and your action history, with screenshots. You need to perform the next action to complete the task.

## Output Format
```
Thought: ...
Action: ...
```

## Action Space

click(start_box='<|box_start|>(x1,y1)<|box_end|>')
left_double(start_box='<|box_start|>(x1,y1)<|box_end|>')
right_single(start_box='<|box_start|>(x1,y1)<|box_end|>')
drag(start_box='<|box_start|>(x1,y1)<|box_end|>', end_box='<|box_start|>(x3,y3)<|box_end|>')
hotkey(key='')
type(content='') #If you want to submit your input, use "\n" at the end of `content`.
scroll(start_box='<|box_start|>(x1,y1)<|box_end|>', direction='down or up or right or left')
wait() #Sleep for 5s and take a screenshot to check for any changes.
finished(content='xxx') # Use escape characters \', \", and \n in content part to ensure we can parse the content in normal python string format.

## Note
- Use English in `Thought` part.
- Write a small plan and finally summarize your next action (with its target element) in one sentence in `Thought` part.
- My computer's password is 'password', feel free to use it when you need sudo rights.

## User Instruction
I have been editing my document and some words that needed to be rewritten are highlighted in yellow. As I fixed those words, please help me remove all highlight. I want to make sure that there is no highlight word.

Thought: I noticed that there are two instances of the word "UCSF" highlighted in yellow in this document. To remove these highlights, I first need to select them. Let me start by clicking on the first highlighted section.
Action: drag(start_box='<|box_start|>(1087,836)<|box_end|>', end_box='<|box_start|>(1164,839)<|box_end|>')

Thought: Great! I've selected the first highlighted text. Now, let me press the Delete key to remove this highlight effect. Once I finish with this one, I'll move on to addressing the second instance of highlighting.
Action: hotkey(key='ctrl a')

hotkey(key='backspace')

Thought: I just deleted the first highlighted text, but now I see that the document has turned completely blank. This indicates that using Ctrl+A and Backspace to remove highlights might not be the best approach. Let me hit Ctrl+Z to undo this action and rethink how to handle these highlights more effectively.
Action: hotkey(key='ctrl z')

Thought: The previous method of deleting highlighted text directly was clearly too simplistic. I've come to realize that the most efficient way to remove all highlights from the document is through a global search and replace operation. So, let me first press Ctrl+H to open the Find and Replace dialog box, which will allow me to clear all highlights at once.
Action: hotkey(key='ctrl h')

Thought: It seems that the Find and Replace dialog box isn't going to work. I need to close it first, then go back to the toolbar and click on the font color button. That should allow me to remove all those highlighted texts.
Action: click(start_box='<|box_start|>(1338,359)<|box_end|>')

Thought: After trying various methods without success, I finally discovered the key to solving the problem. There’s an icon on the toolbar that looks like a paintbrush; clicking on it reveals a dropdown menu where I can find the "No Fill Color" option. By selecting this, I can remove all those annoying yellow highlights at once.
Action: click(start_box='<|box_start|>(1043,152)<|box_end|>')

Thought: Ah, I found the solution! In the color picker panel, there's an option labeled "No Fill," which is exactly what I was looking for. By simply clicking on it, I can instantly remove all those highlighted texts. This method is much more straightforward and effective than manually deleting each one.
Action: click(start_box='<|box_start|>(1029,207)<|box_end|>')

Thought: That's great! I've finally removed all the highlights. However, to make sure these changes aren't lost, I need to quickly save the document using Ctrl+S. After all, nobody wants their hard work on cleaning up those highlighted texts to go to waste.
Action: hotkey(key='ctrl s')

Thought: I just pressed Ctrl+S to save the document, but I still need to double-check if all the highlights have truly been removed. Let me scroll down with my mouse wheel to review the entire document carefully—after all, it's important to ensure that every single highlighted word has been completely cleared out.
Action: scroll(direction='down', start_box='<|box_start|>(1307,642)<|box_end|>')

Thought: I just scrolled through the entire document and confirmed that there are indeed no traces of yellow highlighting anywhere. Reflecting on the whole process, I initially tried a few ineffective methods, such as using keyboard shortcuts and opening the Find dialog box. However, it was only after selecting all the text and clearing it with "No Fill" that I finally achieved a complete cleanup. Now that all these highlighted texts have been thoroughly removed, my task is successfully completed.
Action: finished(content='我成功地把文档里所有的高亮都去掉了，现在整个文档看起来干净整洁，没有一点黄色背景的痕迹。')
